img.alt: Board slides across a boundary between two horizontal surfaces and stops

problem.p: The diagram shows the top view of a horizontal table, separated into two surfaces: A and B. A board of mass \(m\) and length \(L\) is at rest on surface A, oriented perpendicular to the boundary between the surfaces. After a quick push, the board slides into surface B and comes to a stop just as it clears the boundary (see the diagram). The coefficients of sliding friction between the board and surfaces are \(\mu_A\) and \(\mu_B\), respectively. What is the initial speed v of the board?
